result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Ricci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid out of his canteen at the jail.

In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Time currently serving in Case No. 14CM68.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph M Ricci not in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to quash order to show cause as Defendant is current. Court grants request.
Order to show cause hearing at 09-23-2015 10:00 am
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Joseph M Ricci in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Defendant Joseph M Ricci in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea agreement. Guilty plea to count 1. The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. Factual basis found.
